title: Help Please
content:
Can anyone tell me the name of this font, if it’s not custom, or something similar? I’m looking for a Nordic flavor.

Thanks much

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [100\_1723.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024301/http:/typophile.com/files/100_1723.jpg) | 49.7 KB |

 [‹ Font Like Lancome](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024301/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49205 "Go to previous forum topic") [New Hampshire lettering ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024301/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49894 "Go to next forum topic")
author: hmarcks

comments.content:
Kursivschrift (Stehend) has some similarities. You could then add the dots in the ’o’s yourself.

JH

Funny, I think they are using [Plantin Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024301/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/plantin_schoolbook/) and phonetic characters perhaps found in a predigital version of the font. You can also find similar glyphs in [Bembo Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024301/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/bembo_pro_semi_bold/) and [Bembo Infant](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024301/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/bembo_infant_std_vp/).
Thanks much, looks like I’ll have to do some fabricating.
